page.title: 08THE GIANT OF SESSAY .1.
page.content: The story is told because of its connections with the Dawnay family, notably Guy Dawnay whose father died at Cowick in 1493. Sir John's son Guy, came courting Joan Darell, the heiress of Sessay. She accepted his proposal of marriage on one condition. This was that Sir Guy should rid the district of a 'brute' which was terrorising the district. She described the creature as man like, with legs as ponderous as an elephant's, a single eye in the middle of his his forehead, and a mouth like a lion's stuck with teeth as long as the prongs on a hayfork. His clothing was a cow's hide, and his weapon was a tree trunk. Whenever he pleased he helped himself to the farm animals and the village women and children...all of which he ate.
